acl.Description: The canned ACL to apply. Available values include private, public-read, and public-read-write. Defaults to private.

bucket.Description: The name of a bucket to be created.

cors_rules.Description: A rule of Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (documented below).

allowed_methods.Description: Specifies which methods are allowed. Can be GET, PUT, POST, DELETE or HEAD.

expose_headers.Description: Specifies expose header in the response.

max_age_seconds.Description: Specifies time in seconds that browser can cache the response for a preflight request.

lifecycle_rules.Description: A configuration of object lifecycle management (documented below).

expiration.Description: Specifies a period in the object's expire (documented below).

date.Description: Specifies the date after which you want the corresponding action to take effect.

days.Description: Specifies the number of days after object creation when the specific rule action takes effect.

filter_prefix.Description: Object key prefix identifying one or more objects to which the rule applies.

transition.Description: Specifies a period in the object's transitions (documented below).

date.Description: Specifies the date after which you want the corresponding action to take effect.

days.Description: Specifies the number of days after object creation when the specific rule action takes effect.

storage_class.Description: Specifies the storage class to which you want the object to transition. Available values include STANDARD, STANDARD_IA and ARCHIVE.

error_document.Description: An absolute path to the document to return in case of a 4XX error.

index_document.Description: COS returns this index document when requests are made to the root domain or any of the subfolders.

acl.Description: The canned ACL to apply. Available values include private, public-read, and public-read-write. Defaults to private.

bucket.Description: The name of a bucket to use.

cache_control.Description: Specifies caching behavior along the request/reply chain.For further details，RFC2616 can be referred.

content.Description: Literal string value to use as the object content, which will be uploaded as UTF-8-encoded text.

content_disposition.Description: Specifies presentational information for the object.

content_encoding.Description: Specifies what content encodings have been applied to the object and thus what decoding mechanisms must be applied to obtain the media-type referenced by the Content-Type header field.

content_type.Description: A standard MIME type describing the format of the object data.

etag.Description: The ETag generated for the object (an MD5 sum of the object content).

key.Description: The name of the object once it is in the bucket.

source.Description: The path to the source file being uploaded to the bucket.

storage_class.Description: Object storage type, Available values include STANDARD, STANDARD_IA and ARCHIVE.

mysql_id.Description: Instance ID to which the account belongs.

privileges.Description: Database permissions. Available values for Privileges: "SELECT", "INSERT", "UPDATE", "DELETE", "CREATE", "DROP", "REFERENCES", "INDEX", "ALTER", "CREATE TEMPORARY TABLES", "LOCK TABLES","EXECUTE", "CREATE VIEW", "SHOW VIEW", "CREATE ROUTINE", "ALTER ROUTINE", "EVENT", and "TRIGGER".

backup_model.Description: Backup method. Supported values include: physical - physical backup, and logical - logical backup.

backup_time.Description: Instance backup time, in the format of "HH:mm-HH:mm". Time setting interval is four hours. Default to "02:00-06:00". The following value can be supported: 02:00\-06:00, 06:00\-10:00, 10:00\-14:00, 14:00\-18:00, 18:00\-22:00, and 22:00\-02:00.

binlog_period.Description: Retention period for binlog in days.

mysql_id.Description: Instance ID to which policies will be applied.

retention_period.Description: Instance backup retention days. Valid values: [7-730]. And default value is 7.

availability_zone.Description: Indicates which availability zone will be used.

engine_version.Description: The version number of the database engine to use. Supported versions include 5.5/5.6/5.7, and default is 5.7.

first_slave_zone.Description: Zone information about first slave instance.

gtid.Description: Indicates whether GTID is enable. 0 - Not enabled; 1 - Enabled.

instance_name.Description: The name of a mysql instance.

internet_service.Description: Indicates whether to enable the access to an instance from public network: 0 - No, 1 - Yes.

intranet_port.Description: Public access port, rang form 1024 to 65535 and default value is 3306.

locked.Description: Indicates whether the instance is locked. 0 - No; 1 - Yes.

root_password.Description: Password of root account. This parameter can be specified when you purchase master instances, but it should be ignored when you purchase read-only instances or disaster recovery instances.

second_slave_zone.Description: Zone information about second slave instance.

slave_deploy_mode.Description: Availability zone deployment method. Available values: 0 - Single availability zone; 1 - Multiple availability zones.

slave_sync_mode.Description: Data replication mode. 0 - Async replication; 1 - Semisync replication; 2 - Strongsync replication.

status.Description: Instance status. Available values: 0 - Creating; 1 - Running; 4 - Isolating; 5 – Isolated.

subnet_id.Description: Private network ID. If vpc_id is set, this value is required.

task_status.Description: Indicates which kind of operations is being executed.

vpc_id.Description: ID of VPC, which can be modified once every 24 hours and can’t be removed.

gtid.Description: Indicates whether GTID is enable. 0 - Not enabled; 1 - Enabled.

instance_name.Description: The name of a mysql instance.

intranet_port.Description: Public access port, rang form 1024 to 65535 and default value is 3306.

locked.Description: Indicates whether the instance is locked. 0 - No; 1 - Yes.

master_instance_id.Description: Indicates the master instance ID of recovery instances.

status.Description: Instance status. Available values: 0 - Creating; 1 - Running; 4 - Isolating; 5 – Isolated.

subnet_id.Description: Private network ID. If vpc_id is set, this value is required.

task_status.Description: Indicates which kind of operations is being executed.

vpc_id.Description: ID of VPC, which can be modified once every 24 hours and can’t be removed.

backup_period.Description: Specifys which day the backup action should take place. Supported values include: Monday，Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday.

backup_time.Description: Specifys what time the backup action should take place.

redis_id.Description: ID of a Redis instance to which the policy will be applied.

availability_zone.Description: The available zone ID of an instance to be created., refer to tencentcloud_redis_zone_config.list

create_time.Description: The time when the instance was created.

mem_size.Description: The memory volume of an available instance(in MB), refer to tencentcloud_redis_zone_config.list[zone].mem_sizes

password.Description: Password for a Redis user，which should be 8 to 16 characters.

port.Description: The port used to access a redis instance. The default value is 6379. And this value can't be changed after creation, or the Redis instance will be recreated.

project_id.Description: Specifies which project the instance should belong to.

security_groups.Description: ID of security group. If both vpc_id and subnet_id are not set, this argument should not be set either.

status.Description: Current status of an instance，maybe: init, processing, online, isolate and todelete.

subnet_id.Description: Specifies which subnet the instance should belong to.

vpc_id.Description: ID of the vpc with which the instance is to be associated.

bucket.Description: Name of the bucket that contains the objects to query.

cache_control.Description: Specifies caching behavior along the request/reply chain.

content_disposition.Description: Specifies presentational information for the object.

content_encoding.Description: Specifies what content encodings have been applied to the object and thus what decoding mechanisms must be applied to obtain the media-type referenced by the Content-Type header field.

content_type.Description: A standard MIME type describing the format of the object data.

etag.Description: ETag generated for the object，which is may not equal to MD5 value.

key.Description: The full path to the object inside the bucket.

last_modified.Description: Last modified date of the object.

storage_class.Description: Object storage type such as STANDARD.

bucket_list.Description: A list of bucket. Each element contains the following attributes:

cors_rules.Description: A list of CORS rule configurations.

allowed_methods.Description: Specifies which methods are allowed. Can be GET, PUT, POST, DELETE or HEAD.

expose_headers.Description: Specifies expose header in the response.

max_age_seconds.Description: Specifies time in seconds that browser can cache the response for a preflight request.

lifecycle_rules.Description: The lifecycle configuration of a bucket.

expiration.Description: Specifies a period in the object's expire.

date.Description: Specifies the date after which you want the corresponding action to take effect.

days.Description: Specifies the number of days after object creation when the specific rule action takes effect.

filter_prefix.Description: Object key prefix identifying one or more objects to which the rule applies.

transition.Description: Specifies a period in the object's transitions.

date.Description: Specifies the date after which you want the corresponding action to take effect.

days.Description: Specifies the number of days after object creation when the specific rule action takes effect.

storage_class.Description: Specifies the storage class to which you want the object to transition. Available values include STANDARD, STANDARD_IA and ARCHIVE.

website.Description: A list of one element containing configuration parameters used when the bucket is used as a website.

error_document.Description: An absolute path to the document to return in case of a 4XX error.

index_document.Description: COS returns this index document when requests are made to the root domain or any of the subfolders.

bucket_prefix.Description: A prefix string to filter results by bucket name

list.Description: A list of MySQL backup. Each element contains the following attributes:

backup_model.Description: Backup method. Supported values include: physical - physical backup, and logical - logical backup.

creator.Description: The owner of the backup files.

finish_time.Description: The time at which the backup finishes.

time.Description: The earliest time at which the backup starts. For example, 2 indicates 2:00 am.

max_number.Description: The latest files to list, rang from 1 to 10000. And the default value is 10.

mysql_id.Description: Instance ID, such as cdb-c1nl9rpv. It is identical to the instance ID displayed in the database console page.

engine_version.Description: The version number of the database engine to use. Supported versions include 5.5/5.6/5.7.

init_flag.Description: Initialization mark. Available values: 0 - Uninitialized; 1 – Initialized.

instance_list.Description: A list of instances. Each element contains the following attributes:

create_time.Description: The time at which a instance is created.

device_type.Description: Supported instance model.HA - high available version; Basic - basic version.

dr_instance_ids.Description: ID list of disaster-recovory type associated with the current instance.

engine_version.Description: The version number of the database engine to use. Supported versions include 5.5/5.6/5.7.

init_flag.Description: Initialization mark. Available values: 0 - Uninitialized; 1 – Initialized.

instance_role.Description: Instance type. Supported values include: master - master instance, dr - disaster recovery instance, and ro - read-only instance.

intranet_port.Description: Transport layer port number for internal purpose.

mysql_id.Description: Instance ID, such as cdb-c1nl9rpv. It is identical to the instance ID displayed in the database console page.

project_id.Description: Project ID to which the current instance belongs.

ro_instance_ids.Description: ID list of read-only type associated with the current instance.

slave_sync_mode.Description: Data replication mode. 0 - Async replication; 1 - Semisync replication; 2 - Strongsync replication.

status.Description: Instance status. Available values: 0 - Creating; 1 - Running; 4 - Isolating; 5 – Isolated.

subnet_id.Description: ID of subnet to which the current instance belongs.

instance_role.Description: Instance type. Supported values include: master - master instance, dr - disaster recovery instance, and ro - read-only instance.

limit.Description: Number of results returned for a single request. Default is 20, and maximum is 2000.

mysql_id.Description: Instance ID, such as cdb-c1nl9rpv. It is identical to the instance ID displayed in the database console page.

status.Description: Instance status. Available values: 0 - Creating; 1 - Running; 4 - Isolating; 5 – Isolated.

with_dr.Description: Indicates whether to query disaster recovery instances.

with_master.Description: Indicates whether to query master instances.

with_ro.Description: Indicates whether to query read-only instances.

engine_version.Description: The version number of the database engine to use. Supported versions include 5.5/5.6/5.7.

parameter_list.Description: A list of parameters. Each element contains the following attributes:

need_reboot.Description: Indicates whether reboot is needed to enable the new parameters.

list.Description: A list of zone config. Each element contains the following attributes:

disaster_recovery_zones.Description: Information about available zones of recovery.

engine_versions.Description: The version number of the database engine to use. Supported versions include 5.5/5.6/5.7.

first_slave_zones.Description: Zone information about first slave instance.

is_default.Description: Indicates whether the current DC is the default DC for the region. Possible returned values: 0 - No; 1 - Yes.

is_support_disaster_recovery.Description: Indicates whether recovery is supported: 0 - No; 1 - Yes.

is_support_vpc.Description: Indicates whether VPC is supported: 0 - No; 1 - Yes.

name.Description: The name of available zone which is equal to a specific datacenter.

second_slave_zones.Description: Zone information about second slave instance.

sells.Description: A list of supported instance types for sell:

slave_deploy_modes.Description: Availability zone deployment method. Available values: 0 - Single availability zone; 1 - Multiple availability zones.

support_slave_sync_modes.Description: Data replication mode. 0 - Async replication; 1 - Semisync replication; 2 - Strongsync replication.

region.Description: Region parameter, which is used to identify the region to which the data you want to work with belongs.

instance_list.Description: A list of redis instance. Each element contains the following attributes:

create_time.Description: The time when the instance is created.

port.Description: The port used to access a redis instance.

project_id.Description: ID of the project to which a redis instance belongs.

status.Description: Current status of an instance，maybe: init, processing, online, isolate and todelete.

type.Description: Instance type. Available values: master_slave_redis, master_slave_ckv, cluster_ckv, cluster_redis and standalone_redis.

vpc_id.Description: ID of the vpc with which the instance is associated.

zone.Description: Available zone to which a redis instance belongs.

limit.Description: The number limitation of results for a query.

project_id.Description: ID of the project to which  redis instance belongs.

search_key.Description: Key words used to match the results, and the key words can be: instance ID, instance name and IP address.

list.Description: A list of zone. Each element contains the following attributes:

mem_sizes.Description: The memory volume of an available instance（in MB）.

type.Description: Instance type. Available values: master_slave_redis, master_slave_ckv, cluster_ckv, cluster_redis and standalone_redis.

version.Description: Version description of an available instance. Possible values: Redis 3.2, Redis 4.0 .

region.Description: Name of a region. If this value is not set, the current region getting from provider's configuration will be used.
